idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.0.3035

enttyp.enttypd:
The term "hospital" ... means an institution which-
(1) is primarily engaged in providing, by or under the supervision of physicians, to inpatients
> (A) diagnostic services and therapeutic services for medical diagnosis, treatment, and care of injured, disabled, or sick persons, or > (B) rehabilitation services for the rehabilitation of injured, disabled, or sick persons;
(...)
(5) provides 24-hour nursing service rendered or supervised by a registered professional nurse, and has a licensed practical nurse or registered professional nurse on duty at all times; ...
(...)
(7) in the case of an institution in any State in which State or applicable local law provides for the licensing of hospitals,
> (A) is licensed pursuant to such law or > (B) is approved, by the agency of such State or locality responsible for licensing hospitals, as meeting the standards established for such licensing
enttyp.enttypds: Excerpt from Title XVIII of the Social Security Act [42 U.S.C. § 1395x(e)] http://www4.law.cornell.edu/uscode/html/uscode42/usc_sec_42_00001395---x000-.html

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Unique identifier for feature.
Security classification of feature.

edom.edomvd: Entity is unclassified.

attr.attrdef: Name of entity.
Ten (10) digit telephone number for entity formatted as nnn-nnn-nnnn.

attrdomv.udom: Phone numbers formatted as nnn-nnn-nnnn. Only numeric digits are used. The area code and exchange must form a valid combination. A list of valid area code and exchange combinations can be obtained from <http://www.nanpa.com>.

attr.attrdef: Physical street address for entity. "PO Box", "General Delivery", "Rural Route", and "Highway Contract" addresses are not considered physical addresses and should not appear in this field. Some areas do not have regular city style addressing, so entities in those areas may not have a street number. In such cases, the name of the road on which they are located is listed in this field. Some rural areas may not have named roads. In these rare cases, this field will be blank.
Location within physical address, e.g., floor, suite, building.

The name of the city associated with the entity's physical address. For physical addresses that the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) delivers to, this should be a "city" acceptable to the USPS as defined in their Address Information System (AIS). Sometimes the USPS does not deliver mail to a physical address but recognizes the location (i.e., they list the location as "undeliverable"). The cities associated with these locations are acceptable. In some cases, the USPS does not recognize individual physical addresses in a city, rather, they list the city as having "General Delivery". In these cases, the city and associated zip code are acceptable (the entity's [ADDRESS] field will contain a street address, not "general delivery"). The entity may not actually be located within the city limits of the "city" specified in its [CITY] field. Instead, it may actually be located within the city limits of another city. In some cases, the "city" that appears in this field may not even be a city in an administrative sense, but it is still an acceptable "city" to the USPS. An example of this is "Notre Dame, IN". There is no city in Indiana called "Notre Dame", but this is considered an acceptable city by the USPS for any delivery going to the University of Notre Dame which is actually located in the city of South Bend. "Notre Dame", like most USPS cities, is an easily recognized place, and it gives the user of the data a good general idea of where the entity is located (if the entity is located in a small municipality, the USPS "city" may be more recognizable than the name of the municipality), and it would be part of the address one would use to send a shipment to the entity's location. Using the USPS acceptable "city" also allows someone to do a logical consistency check between the zip code and the city by using the USPS AIS.
Sometimes an entity may report a city that is not accepted by the USPS, and although TGS has tried to replace those cities with an acceptable alternative, some of them may remain in this dataset.

Two (2) character abbreviation for state associated with the entity's physical address. In almost all cases, this is the same as the state where the entity has been depicted geospatially. However, there are cases, particularly where an entity is part of a larger facility that cuts across state lines, where the entity's location may be depicted in a state other than the one indicated in this field. Also, the state in which an entity appears to be located may change depending on the scale of the state boundary theme being used.
Five (5) digit USPS zip code for entity's physical location.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS Address Information System - Domain is further restricted by only allowing physical (non PO Box) zip codes.

attr.attrdef: Four (4) digit USPS zip code extension. These values are automatically assigned using the entity's physical address and USPS address information system (AIS) data.
County name where entity is located.

codesetd.codesets: US Department of the Interior - US Geologic Survey

attr.attrdef: Five (5) digit FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) Code for the County where entity is located. The first two (2) digits represent the state and the last three (3) digits identify the county within the state.

codesetd.codesetn: Federal Information Processing Standards Publications - Counties and Equivalent Entities of the U.S., Its Possessions, and Associated Areas.
codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) <http://www.itl.nist.gov/fipspubs/co-codes/states.txt>

attr.attrdef: Directions to entity location, or description of the entity's location.
Title of person or name of office for emergency point of contact.
Ten (10) digit telephone number of emergency point of contact formatted as nnn-nnn-nnnn. All alphabetic characters have been translated to the corresponding numeric digit.

attrdomv.udom: Phone numbers, including area code, formatted as nnn-nnn-nnnn. A list of valid area code and exchange combinations can be found at http://www.nanpa.com

attr.attrdef: Telephone extension for emergency point of contact.
Date entity was contacted by TGS.
Method by which entity was contacted.

edom.edomvd: Entity was contacted by phone.
Entity was contacted by fax.
Entity was contacted by mail.
Entity was contacted by email.
Entity information was gathered and/or verified by official entity website as a last resort.
Geospatial reference information obtained from local authorities, e.g., downloadable parcel maps, 911 streets, and shape files.
Entity has not been contacted by TGS.

attr.attrdef: Date entity was geocoded by TGS.
Method by which entity was geocoded.

edom.edomvd: Entity was automatically geocoded.
Entity was manually geocoded.
Entity was shifted by TGS to an updated set of NAVTEQ streets. This only applies if the entity was manually geocoded by TGS to a previous version of NAVTEQ streets.
Entity was geocoded using coordinates provided by the original source.

attr.attrdef: NAICS (North American Industry Classification System) Code for entity. NAICS Codes (and NAICS Descriptions) have been assigned based upon the entity's primary function, regardless of if that is the function that qualified it to be included in this dataset.

NAICS (North American Industry Classification System) Description for entity. The "Index Entries" that appear on the NAICS webpage (<http://www.census.gov/epcd/www/naics.html>) are being used to populate this field, as opposed to the "NAICS Title". While there is a one to one correspondence between NAICS Codes and "NAICS Titles", there is a one to many relationship between NAICS Codes and the "Index Entries". By using the "Index Entries", we have placed the entities that make up this layer into more specific categories; however, the user of this data should be aware that this was not the intended purpose of these "Index Entries". The "Index Entries" were intended as a way to search the NAICS database and as a way of enumerating ways in which establishments falling under the given NAICS Code may be named. Thus, there are often two or more "Index Entries" that are synonyms, for example: "Prisons" and "Penitentiaries". In cases like this, we have standardized on one "Index Entry".
NAICS Descriptions (and NAICS Codes) have been assigned based upon the entity's primary function, regardless of if that is the function that qualified it to be included in this dataset.

edom.edomvd: CANCER HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide care for cancer patients are classified under this description.

CHILDREN'S HOSPITALS, GENERAL - [NAICS Code 622110]: Entities that are known and licensed as general medical and surgical hospitals that provide general care to children are classified under this description.

edom.edomv: CHILDREN'S HOSPITALS, PSYCHIATRIC OR SUBSTANCE ABUSE
edom.edomvd: CHILDREN'S HOSPITALS, PSYCHIATRIC OR SUBSTANCE ABUSE - [NAICS Code 622210]: Entities that are known and licensed as psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals that provide treatment for children are classified under this description.

edom.edomv: CHILDREN'S HOSPITALS, SPECIALTY (EXCEPT PSYCHIATRIC, SUBSTANCE ABUSE)
edom.edomvd: CHILDREN'S HOSPITALS, SPECIALTY (EXCEPT PSYCHIATRIC, SUBSTANCE ABUSE) - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide treatment of a specific type of disease or medical condition for children that is not psychiatric or substance abuse related are classified under this description.

DETOXIFICATION HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622210]: Entities that are known and licensed as psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals that provide medically supervised inpatient treatment to people with physical and psychological dependence on alcohol or drugs are classified under this description.

edom.edomv: EYE, EAR, NOSE, AND THROAT HOSPITALS
edom.edomvd: EYE, EAR, NOSE, AND THROAT HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide treatment for all conditions relating to the eyes, ears, nose, and throat are classified under this description.

HOSPITALS, ADDICTION - [NAICS Code 622210]: Entities that are known and licensed as psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals that provide inpatient treatment for all people with a physical or psychological need for a habit-forming substance, such as a drug or alcohol, are classified under this description.

HOSPITALS, GENERAL MEDICAL AND SURGICAL - [NAICS Code 622110]: Entities that are known and licensed as general medical and surgical hospitals that provide general medical treatment are classified under this description.

HOSPITALS, MENTAL (EXCEPT MENTAL RETARDATION) - [NAICS Code 622210]: Entities that are known and licensed as psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals that provide inpatient treatment for all people affected with disorders of the mind who are not mentally retarded are classified under this description.

HOSPITALS, PSYCHIATRIC (EXCEPT CONVALESCENT) - [NAICS Code 622210]: Entities that are known and licensed as psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals that provide treatment and prevention of mental and emotional disorders without recovery are classified under this description.

HOSPITALS, SPECIALTY (EXCEPT PSYCHIATRIC, SUBSTANCE ABUSE) - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide treatment for a specific type of disease or medical condition that is not psychiatric or substance abuse related are classified under this description.

MENTAL RETARDATION HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 623210]: Entities that are known and licensed as mental retardation hospitals that provide residential care services for persons diagnosed with mental retardation are classified under this description.

NEUROLOGICAL HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide treatment in dealing with disorders of the nervous system are classified under this description.

OBSTETRICAL HOSPITAL - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide treatment of women during and after pregnancy are classified under this description.

ORTHOPEDIC HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide prevention or correction of injuries or disorders of the skeletal system and associated muscles, joints, and ligaments are classified under this description.

OSTEOPATHIC HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622110]: Entities that are known and licensed as general medical and surgical hospitals that provide treatment for disorders which can be corrected by various manipulative techniques in conjunction with conventional medical, surgical, pharmacological, and other therapeutic procedures are classified under this description.

REHABILITATION HOSPITALS (EXCEPT ALCOHOLISM, DRUG ADDICTION) - [NAICS Code 622310]: Entities that are known and licensed as specialty hospitals that provide restoration of a sick or disabled person by therapeutic measures and reeducation that are not dependent on drugs or alcohol are classified under this description.

edom.edomv: TUBERCULOSIS AND OTHER RESPIRATORY ILLNESS HOSPITALS
edom.edomvd: TUBERCULOSIS AND OTHER RESPIRATORY ILLNESS HOSPITALS - [NAICS Code 622310]: This industry consists of establishments known and licensed as specialty hospitals primarily engaged in providing diagnostic and medical treatment to inpatients with tuberculosis and other respiratory illnesses (except psychiatric or substance abuse).

attr.attrdef: Link ID for the street segment to which the entity was geocoded. Refer to the [ST_VENDOR] and [ST_VERSION] fields for the street vendor and version that was used to geocode the entity.
Longitude in WGS 84 Decimal Degrees.
Latitude in WGS 84 Decimal Degrees.
Indicates name of vendor providing original street data used for geocoding.

edom.edomvd: NAVTEQ streets were used for geocoding.
TGS drew in a new street segment that does not exist in the file supplied by NAVTEQ.
TIGER/Line streets were used for geocoding.

attr.attrdef: Indicates the year and quarter of streets used for geocoding.

edom.edomvd: 1st Quarter 2008 NAVTEQ street data was used for geocoding.
2006fe version of TIGER/Line streets were used for geocoding in areas where NAVTEQ does not have coverage.

attr.attrdef: Geocoding precision.

edom.edomvd: Entity is geocoded to correct block and correct side of street per street data indicated by [ST_VENDOR] and [ST_VERSION].
Entity is geocoded on entity rooftop per aerial imagery (in most cases USGS DOQQs).

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether the phone number in the [TELEPHONE] field rings to the actual location of the entity.

edom.edomvd: Phone number rings to the actual entity location.
Phone number does not ring to the actual entity location. It may ring to an administrative office or central location.
Unknown - It is not known if the entity's phone number rings to the entity's location.

attr.attrdef: Organization that performed Quality Control/Quality Assurance on the record.

edom.edomvd: TGS has performed Quality Control/Quality Assurance on all TGS added records and all records contacted since 01/01/2005.
The record is not TGS added or has not had Quality Control/Quality Assurance performed by TGS, or Quality Control/Quality Assurance was performed prior to 01/01/2005.

attr.attrdef: State Hospital Data ID. For states that contributed data, this field is populated with the unique ID used by the state to track hospitals.

Hospital's license number.
The values in this field have not been verified by TGS.

Total number of beds per facility.
The values in this field have not been verified by TGS.

Emergency Contact Number as provided by individual states. Some values also include telephone extensions and/or alternate telephone numbers. All alphabetic characters have been translated to the corresponding numeric digit.
The values in this field have not been verified by TGS.

attrdomv.udom: Phone numbers, including area code, formatted as nnn-nnn-nnnn. A list of valid area code and exchange combinations can be found at <http://www.nanpa.com>

Entity is not a trauma level 1 facility.

attr.attrdef:
Indicates the type of hospital.
The values in this field have not been verified by TGS.

Indicates the type of owner for the hospital.

The unique permanent identifier of The National Structures Dataset.

The unique permanent identifier of the Geographic Names Information System that is up to eight (8) digits in length and unique within the nation.
The values in this field have not been verified by TGS.
